result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay C Marks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Peter Masana
Filed by Atty. Peter Masana

Defendant Lindsay C Marks in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of amended information.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include: $443.00 costs.  Anger management evaluation and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  1 day jail credit.
Amended Information filed by Atty Burdon
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
